title: The Making of prosperity and poverty
description: This quiz is related to chapter 3 of Why Nations Fail.

questions_attributes.question_text: Why could not Kongolese people go towards prosperity, historically speaking?

question_options_attributes.option_text: The government provided quite few public services to its citizens.
The colonization was the main reason of destruction
Any increased productivity by technology would've only resulted in more plundering and expropriation from the government
The slaves were not properly distributed in Sao Salvador and Congo which affected the slaves trade.

questions_attributes.question_text: What was the standing army of Kongolese King in mid seventeenth century?
What was the purpose of Zairianization program in 1973, held under Mobutu?

question_options_attributes.option_text: Political Reforms to decentralize the state and its political power
Remove the remains and influences of the Belgian colonisation
Foreign Aid for increase in literacy for Kongolese people
Give the authoritarian control to the army

questions_attributes.question_text: What were the reason(s) that the Carribbean Islands were some of the richest areas in the sixteenth and eighteenth century?

question_options_attributes.option_text: The working conditions of the slaves who were working for the planter elite, were much better
The export system of these islands was good and generated a lot of money, despite the slavery and bad conditions
The planter's elite were kind of enough to sell the planters the whole lands
The culture consisted of hardwork, consistence and power, which was the main cause of better economic growth

questions_attributes.question_text: When did General Park take over South Korea?
According to the author, the economic progress of China is similar to what other state?

question_options_attributes.option_text: United States of America after its independence
Soviet Union in 1920s
South Korea after the cold war
English Industrial Revolution

questions_attributes.question_text: Choose the condition(s), according to the author, that can help growth under extractive institutions

question_options_attributes.option_text: If the elites utilize the extractive institutions, they can achieve sustained growth and prosperity in the long run.
Political decentralization can yield better succeses with extractive institutions
Growth is possible if resources can be allocated to high productivity activities that elites control
Somewhat inclusive institutions despite the economy model being primarily exclusive

questions_attributes.question_text: According to the author, what is the most important factor to promote economic growth, irrespective of the nature of economic institutes

question_options_attributes.option_text: Powerful economic families that can control the state
Political Centralization to enforce law and order
Good foreign relations and positive image internationally
Suitable culture, nature of people and geography to promote economic growth
